activities:
As a common carrier, Packet does not maintain access to data housed on servers which are leased by customers, and housed in its datacenter locations.  These resources are managed by Packet's customers, whom we advise to safeguard their data in accordance with industry best-practices.  Packet's datacenter locations are secured by its facilities providers, who deploy multiple factors of authentication (e.g. proximity card, biometrics, and physical patrol), to ensure the security of the hardware even when a single method of access is breached.  

Packet processes customer data including administrative contacts, addresses, telephone numbers, e-mail addresses, and correspondence/trouble ticket history.  This data is safeguarded using industry best-practices, including VPN and two-factor authentication.  In addition, customer payment details such as credit card information is processed in accordance with Pay Card Industry (PCI) requirements.

Packet complies with lawful requests for access to customer data and leased hardware.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: Administrative contacts, addresses, telephone numbers, e-mail addresses, and correspondence/trouble ticket history; payment details.
privacyprograms: Packet adheres to the Safe Harbor Privacy Principles, in addition to appropriate industry best-practices.
recoursemech:
First and foremost, customers may contact Packet's management team via e-mail or mail regarding any complaints with its Safe Harbor practices.

Any unresolved disputes may be brought before JAMS as listed in our Privacy Policy https://www.packet.net/about/terms/privacy/ under Dispute Resolution section.
